nl: An ideal $N$ is called nilpotent if $N^{n}$ is the zero ideal for some $n \geq 1$. Prove that the ideal $p \mathbb{Z} / p^{m} \mathbb{Z}$ is a nilpotent ideal in the ring $\mathbb{Z} / p^{m} \mathbb{Z}$.
lean:
∀ {p m : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime) :
  IsNilpotent (span ({↑p} : Set $ ZMod $ p^m), Ideal $ ZMod $ p^m)
candidate: ∀ (R : Type u) [CommRing R] (I : Ideal R) (e : ℕ) (h : (I ^ e) = ⊥), IsNilpotent I
imports:
import Mathlib

open Fintype Subgroup Set Polynomial Ideal
open scoped BigOperators
